intro: Dichostylis castanea, commonly known as the red hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from red to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its natural distribution in the wild.
